com.blockhaus2000.util

Class ReflectionUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blockhaus2000.util.ReflectionUtil

  • public class ReflectionUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is to simplify the usage of reflection.
    Author:
    Blockhaus2000

    • Method Detail

      • getField

        public static java.lang.reflect.Field getField(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                               java.lang.String fieldName)
        Searchs in the given Class for the given field name. if it is not found, it will search in the superclass and so on, until the superclass is null.

        NOTE: No exception will be thrown here, because the only exception NoSuchFieldException fails silent. This fails silent because this method checks that the field is available. If not, this method gets the superclass and checks again. If no field has been found, this method returns null.

        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class where the method has to search for the given field name.
        fieldName - The field name to search for.
        Returns:
        The field if foudn, otherwise null.

      • getFieldValue

        public static <T> T getFieldValue(java.lang.Object obj,
                  java.lang.String fieldName)
        Gets the value of the given field name in the given Object. Will call getField(Class, String) to get the field.

        NOTE: This method does not throw any exception. If an exception is thrown internal, this will return null.

        Parameters:
        obj - The Object where the field is stored.
        fieldName - The field name to search for.
        Returns:
        The value of the field if found, otherwise null.
        See Also:
        getField(java.lang.Class, java.lang.String)

      • setField

        public static void setField(java.lang.Object obj,
            java.lang.String fieldName,
            java.lang.Object value)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Sets the value of the given field name in the given Object to the given value. Will call getField(Class, String) to get the field.
        Parameters:
        obj - The Object where the field name can be found.
        fieldName - The field name to search for.
        value - The new value for the given field.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - Will be thrown, if the field access is not allowed.
        See Also:
        getField(java.lang.Class, java.lang.String)

      • hasSuperclass

        public static boolean hasSuperclass(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                    java.lang.Class<?> superClass)
        Checks that the given Class has the given super Class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class to check for the given super Class.
        superClass - The super Class that has to be implemented by the given Class.
        Returns:
        A boolean value if the given Class has the given super Class.
